metadata.Title: CVE-2018-11508 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
The compat_get_timex function in kernel/compat.c in the Linux kernel before4.16.9 allows local users to obtain sensitive information from kernelmemory via adjtimex.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-11508` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-24-generic - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-24-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-24-lowlatency - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-24-generic - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-24-lowlatency - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1014-azure - 4.15.0-1014.14~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1014-gcp - 4.15.0-1014.14~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1031-oem - 4.13.0-1031.35
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1014.14~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1014.14~16.04.1').
linux-oem package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1031.35').
